translation.en: -Hey, Mom. -[Carol] Good morning!
[Carol] Oh, Katie, I have so much to tell you.
So we went out for the other Carol's birthday,
and I bought her a top from Chico's. And then she opens Angie's present.
translation.ko: 선물로 '치코스'에서 옷을 샀는데 글쎄 앤지가 사 온 선물이!

translation.en: You are not going to believe this...
-It was the same top? -It was the same top!
Different color though, she's keeping them both.
translation.ko: 색깔은 다르긴 한데 아무튼 두 벌 다 입는대

translation.en: That new "Bachelorette" gets on my nerves.
Who wears a bikini top to a wine tasting?
translation.ko: 누가 와인 시음회에 비키니 톱을 입고 간대요?

translation.en: [both] And why does she keep bringing up her dead brother?
translation.ko: 죽은 형제 얘기는 또 왜 자꾸 꺼낸대?

translation.en: [Katie] I have to go, I'm gonna miss my bus.
Well, you wouldn't have to commute if you lived in New Jersey.
translation.ko: 뉴저지에 살면 버스로 통근 안 해도 될 텐데

translation.en: [Carol] Your room is just the way you left it.
Your father can sleep in there and you can sleep with me!
translation.ko: 너희 아빠 자라고 하면 되겠다 네가 나랑 자고!

translation.en: No, Mom, I love New York! The energy, the glamour--
translation.ko: 아뇨, 전 뉴욕이 좋아요 이렇게 활기차고 화려한...

translation.en: Did that rat just jump or did somebody throw that at me?
translation.ko: 웬 쥐가 저한테 날아왔어요! 아니면 누가 던졌나?

translation.en: [Carol] I saw the show last night. Which segment was yours?
translation.ko: 어젯밤 뉴스 봤다 어떤 코너가 네 거였니?

translation.en: I produced the one about Halloween costumes for obese pets.
translation.ko: 비만 아동을 위한 핼러윈 의상에 관한 뉴스요

translation.en: Oh, it was good!
translation.ko: 정말 좋은 뉴스였어! 뚱뚱한 드라큘라 개도 멋졌고

translation.en: -I liked the dog that was a fat Dracula. -[Katie] No, Mom.
translation.ko: 정말 좋은 뉴스였어! 뚱뚱한 드라큘라 개도 멋졌고 아니에요

translation.en: I've been at this show for three years and I have never produced a lead segment.
translation.ko: 이 프로에서 3년간 일했는데 메인 뉴스를 한 번도 못 맡았어요

translation.en: Greg gives me all the fluff pieces.
[Katie] I'm treading water.
Well, you have to say to Greg,
"Listen, I'm the best and if you can't see it, you're an idiot!"
translation.ko: '잘 들어요, 난 최고예요 그걸 몰라보는 댁이 바보고요'

translation.en: [Katie] You can't call your boss an idiot.
-I'm finally at work, Mom. I have to go. -[Carol] OK. Call you in ten.
Oh! I'm exhausted. I was in LA last night for the NFL Honors.
translation.ko: 피곤해 죽겠어요, 어젯밤에 LA의 NFL 시상식에 갔거든요

translation.en: My fiancé won for Lewdest Touchdown Dance.
translation.ko: 제 약혼자가 저질 터치다운 댄스 상을 탔죠

translation.en: Good morning, everyone. Just a warning, David Muir interviewed Putin last night.
translation.ko: 좋은 아침이에요, 다만 어젯밤에 데이비드 뮤어가 푸틴을인터뷰해서

translation.en: So be prepared for Chuck to be in a bad mood.
-Now, who has segment pitches? -Oh, yeah. The Washington Post led with--
What if we did a segment called, "Am I Snapchatting My Vacation Wrong?"
Great! Katie, you can produce that.
The Washington Post led with the UN Summit.
Right! We'll open with Chuck doing a UN piece. Gene, you produce that.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 척이 그 소식으로 뉴스를 시작하죠, 진이 제작해요

translation.en: You know who I hate?
Ivanka Trump? Same. You know, she farted in my face at "SoulCycle."
translation.ko: 이방카 트럼프? 저도 싫어요 헬스장에서 저한테 방귀를 뀌었죠

translation.en: Young "rock and roll" reporters like David Muir.
This industry is plagued by ageism.
translation.ko: 이 업계는 요즘 연장자 차별이 극심해

translation.en: Unless you Twitter and know the slang, they'll throw you out like a newspaper.
translation.ko: 트위터 안 하고 유행어 모르면 어젯자 신문처럼 내다 버린다니까

translation.en: Which everyone's reading on their watch now, I guess.
[sarcastic] "Uh, Twitter: I ate a salad!
Pound sign, I'm cool!"
Here's your coffee, sir. I'm Cody! The new intern.
translation.ko: 커피 가져왔습니다 전 새 인턴인 코디예요

translation.en: I'm sure we'll be very close.
Greg, fire Cody, and get someone to bring me coffee.
translation.ko: 그레그, 코디 자르고 커피 가져올 새 인턴 구해

translation.en: Good meeting.
Listen, Bub, I'm the best...
-What? -Nothing.
I'm so sorry I said that. Don't worry about it.
translation.ko: 괜한 말 해서 미안해요 신경 쓰지 마세요

translation.en: [groans] Justin, everything sucks.
I just want to be a great journalist. It's been my dream since forever.
translation.ko: 훌륭한 저널리스트가 되는 게 오래전부터 꿈이었는데 말이죠

translation.en: You know what? Dreams just mess you up. I used to dream of being a doctor.
translation.ko: 꿈은 사람을 망쳐 놔요 한때 의사가 되는 꿈을 꿨거든요

translation.en: But every time I went into surgery, my hands became dog mouths,
translation.ko: 근데 수술실에만 들어가면 손이 개 주둥이가 되는 거예요

translation.en: which was very frustrating -because it was affecting my dexterity. -Eww.
translation.ko: 엄청 짜증 났죠 내 손놀림을 개판 쳤으니까

translation.en: I stopped drinking soda and now I don't have that dream.
translation.ko: 밤에 마시던 탄산을 끊었더니 이젠 그 꿈도 안 꿔요

translation.en: -[Justin] See what I'm saying? -[phone rings]
Hey, Mom.
[crying] The other Carol died!
Oh, my God! What?
It was a heart attack! No one saw it coming.
[sniffles] I mean, she was 400 pounds and she screamed at the news a lot.
translation.ko: 체중이 180kg이나 나갔고 뉴스를 보며 소리를 질러댔지만

translation.en: But hindsight is 20/20.
Mom, I'm so sorry.
Hey, I had an idea about that Snapchat piece.
translation.ko: 케이티, 스냅챗 코너에 관한 아이디어가 있어요

translation.en: I shouldn't have let her eat the cake!
translation.ko: 케이크 한 판을 다 먹게 놔두지 말걸

translation.en: -Can you hang on one second? -Sure.
What if instead of doing it on the show, we did it on Snapchat?
translation.ko: 뉴스에서 하는 대신 스냅챗으로 하면 어때요?

translation.en: -You there? -You listening?
Yeah, I am.
-[Portia] Any ideas? -[Carol] No one to go to the funeral with.
translation.ko: - 장례식에 동행할 사람이 없어 - 아무튼 좋은 생각 있어요?

translation.en: What about Dad?
Dads on Snapchat?
[Carol] Well, him.
-But I mean no one fun. -That's the piece.
-[Carol] Can you come? -[Portia] Work on it?
Yes, I can.
[both] Great! Bye.
Bye.
-Sorry I'm late. -It's OK, honey.
It took them forever to carry in the casket.
translation.ko: 관을 옮기는 데 시간이 한참 걸렸거든

translation.en: Because of her weight.
Halfway down, they just slid it.
Dave, breathe through your nose or wait outside.
translation.ko: 데이브 코로 숨 쉬든가 밖에서 기다려

translation.en: [Dave] OK, you bet!
Love you, Dad.
Carol accomplished a lot in her time on earth.
She was a stay-at-home mom, a licensed driver,
and a dedicated Doctor... [clears throat] Phil viewer.
But she also had big dreams.
Carol's dream was to visit the castle in England where Harry Potter was filmed.
translation.ko: '해리 포터'를 촬영한 영국의 성을 방문하는 거였어요

translation.en: [priest] But the Lord called her home.
If we can learn anything from Carol's passing, it is this:
translation.ko: 캐럴의 죽음이 우리에게 주는 교훈은 이겁니다

translation.en: if you have a dream, you must go after it.
[priest] Not next year.
Not next week. Now.
Amen.
Greg, can I ask you something?
No, we can't soundproof the women's room.
translation.ko: 여자 화장실엔 방음 설비 못 한다니까요

translation.en: I'm sorry if the camera department can hear you in there.
translation.ko: 촬영팀한테 일 보는 소리가 다 들린다고 해도 별수 없어요

translation.en: That was an anonymous suggestion and it wasn't me.
translation.ko: 익명 탄원이었잖아요 제가 쓴 게 아니라고요

translation.en: No, I want to produce the lead. Tonight.
translation.ko: 그게 아니라, 오늘 밤 메인 뉴스 제작을 맡겨주세요

translation.en: No.
Wait, why "no"?
[Greg] Because Chuck is difficult and I trust Gene.
Maybe you trust Gene because he's a man.
Have you taken the "Implicit Bias Test"? My results said I distrust white people.
translation.ko: '잠재적 편견 테스트' 해봤어요? 전 백인을 믿지 않는다고 나왔어요

translation.en: -Do you think I'm being sexist? -I have worked here longer than Gene.
translation.ko: - 내가 성차별주의자라고요? - 제가 진보다 오래 일했는데

translation.en: -Why else, then? -Maybe you're not as good.
translation.ko: - 왜 기회를 안 주죠? - 실력이 부족한가 보죠

translation.en: -Ever considered that? -No, I had not.
translation.ko: - 그 생각은 안 해봤어요? - 네... 안 해봤어요

translation.en: [Greg] Good journalists, like Gene,
can produce a segment without someone saying, "Good job, little one!"
translation.ko: 누가 칭찬해주지 않아도 뉴스 코너를 제작할 수 있어요

translation.en: Good journalists know when to scrap a story
translation.ko: 좋은 저널리스트는 더 나은 뉴스가 있다면

translation.en: and think on their feet if a better one comes along.
translation.ko: 준비한 뉴스를 버리고 순발력 있게 대응하죠

translation.en: [Greg] You can't do that.
-I don't think you think you can either. -You don't know what I don't think.
translation.ko: - 본인 생각에도 그렇죠? - 멋대로 짐작하지 마세요

translation.en: Hey, there's our girl! You really showed that toilet who's boss.
translation.ko: 화장실 장군이 여기 있네! 일 한번 거하게 치르던데요

translation.en: That wasn't me, Ron!
Thanks for finally joining us.
Can I get you a drink, a cranberry scone, an emoji?
translation.ko: 뭐 좀 들겠나? 크랜베리 스콘? 이모티콘?

translation.en: [Chuck] Or start the meeting?
Let's start. Let's lead with the hurricane--
Oh, I have a story pitch: why is bathroom water sweeter than kitchen water?
translation.ko: 아이디어 있어요, '어째서 화장실 물이 주방 물보다 달까?'

translation.en: [Greg] Fine. Katie, you take that. Gene, you take the hurricane.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 케이티가 맡아요 진, 허리케인 뉴스 맡아요

translation.en: -[Greg] Now, for the B Block-- -I'd like to ask you something!
translation.ko: - 그리고 B 블록은... - 요청할 게 있습니다!

translation.en: I have never produced a lead. Ever. And I've worked here longer than Gene.
translation.ko: 전 진보다 오래 일했는데도 메인 뉴스를 제작한 적이 없어요

translation.en: -Which white guy is Gene? -I am.
[Katie] And I think I could do it if I'm just given the chance.
translation.ko: 기회만 주어진다면 정말 잘할 수 있습니다

translation.en: Shouldn't seniority count for something?
Yes. Yes, it should.
This person is doing the hurricane lead!
Greg, that's what's wrong with this business.
translation.ko: 그레그, 이 업계는 바로 저런 게 문제야

translation.en: Nobody rewards experience! Well, I do!
translation.ko: 다들 경험을 무시하지 하지만 난 달라!

translation.en: My personal trainer lives in a nursing home!
Very excited to work together.
Oh, hi! What are you doing here?
Did Dad finally run off because of how you treat him?
translation.ko: 결국 아빠가 도망 나갔어요? 엄마가 아빠 그렇게 다뤄서?

translation.en: No! He's in the car. I cracked a window, he's fine.
translation.ko: 아니야, 차에 있어 창문 살짝 열어뒀으니 괜찮아

translation.en: Listen, I'm going back to school.
-That's great! -I'm gonna study television production.
The admissions lady said I could get credit for an internship!
translation.ko: 학교 직원 말로는 인턴을 하면 학점을 준다더라

translation.en: -Good for you, Mom. -So I'm getting one here.
What? What? No, no! Why? Help!
Yeah, the show needs an intern.
The lady said that students should use their connections in the industry.
translation.ko: 그 교직원도 이 업계에선 연줄을 잘 활용해야 한댔거든

translation.en: So, I'm starting from the bottom.
Like that rapper sings. Who's that guy?
translation.ko: 그 래퍼 노래처럼 그 남자 이름이 뭐더라?

translation.en: Canadian wheelchair guy who dated Nicole Mirage?
translation.ko: 니콜 뭐시기랑 사귄 휠체어 탄 캐나다인?

translation.en: -Drake. Drake, Mom. -Yes!
And that's crazy. It's one thing to take a class to keep busy,
translation.ko: 아무튼 이건 아니죠 수업 듣는 거야 그렇다 치는데

translation.en: but you can't embark on a giant new career, at your age.
translation.ko: 엄마 나이에 거창한 새 커리어를 시작할 순 없어요

translation.en: Why? It's my dream!
If you have a dream, you must go after it.
[priest] Not next year. Not next week.
Now.
-Now, Carol! -Amen.
What? No, Father Kevin was talking to me!
translation.ko: 네? 아뇨, 케빈 신부님은 저한테 말씀하고 계셨어요

translation.en: Since when has it been your dream to work in the news?
translation.ko: 그리고 대체 언제부터 뉴스 제작이 꿈이었다고요?

translation.en: Since always!
But then I met your father and quit my job to raise you.
translation.ko: 그러다 네 아빠를 만나고 널 키우려고 직장을 관둔 거야

translation.en: OK, Mom, you do not want to be an intern.
translation.ko: 하지만 인턴 일은 즐겁지 않을 거예요

translation.en: It is boring and thankless...
Boring and thankless? I was a mom for thirty years.
translation.ko: 그런 일엔 익숙해 내가 30년간 엄마였다, 얘

translation.en: I cleaned barf out of the tape deck of a Teddy Ruxpin.
translation.ko: 말하는 곰 인형의 테이프 덱에서 토사물을 닦아낸 적도 있다고

translation.en: Well, I am sorry, Mom, because we already filled that internship opening.
She's lying! I'd be happy to accept your application, young lady!
[flattered] Oh!
-What are you doing? -Hiring your mother as our intern.
translation.ko: - 뭐 하는 거예요? - 케이티 어머니를 채용하려고요

translation.en: Look, I get that you're mad that I went over your head with Chuck.
translation.ko: 제가 아까 멋대로 나서서 화나신 건 알겠는데

translation.en: This isn't the way to get back at me. Spread a rumor that I'm an alcoholic.
translation.ko: 이런 식으로 복수하면 안 되죠 내가 알코올 중독이라고소문내세요

translation.en: -Or slut-shame me. -This has nothing to do with you.
translation.ko: - 헤프다고 해도 좋고 - 이건 당신과는 상관없어요

translation.en: If I hire an "Old" as an intern, it will finally get Chuck off my back.
When he yells about ageism, I can point to this "Old."
translation.ko: 차별 얘기를 꺼낼 때마다 저 '노인'을 가리키면 되니까요

translation.en: Oh, your ring is so big! Did he cheat?
Mom.
No. If he does I have just the thing picked out.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 그때를 대비해 비싼 걸 골라두긴 했죠

translation.en: I didn't know your mom lives ten minutes from here.
-Why not move in with her? -That's what I always say.
translation.ko: - 왜 같이 안 살아요? - 나도 늘 그렇게 얘기하는데

translation.en: Hi, I'm the Executive Producer.
Oh, you must be Greg.
-He's not that tiny. -OK, good interview.
translation.ko: - 별로 안 작네 - 면접은 이 정도면 됐어요

translation.en: -You're hired! -What?
-When can you start? -How about today?
-Perfect. -[Carol] Oh! I love this man.
translation.ko: - 좋아요 - 이 친구 너무 맘에 드네

translation.en: -[whispering] You should date him. -Mom!
The job's simple. Except you have to be careful around Chuck.
translation.ko: 하는 일은 간단해요 척 옆에선 조심해야 하지만요

translation.en: Why? Is he "handsy" with the girls?
I don't mind.
No, but he loves to fire interns.
Oh. Well, I get along with everybody.
Chuck gets his lunch at one. His snack at two-thirty.
At three is his nap, so his snack must arrive at 2:30.
translation.ko: 3시에 낮잠을 자요 그러니까 간식이 늦어선 안 돼요

translation.en: -Got it? -Yes.
-Say it back to me. -Oh, then no.
Start with this guy in the kayak, going past the submerged car.
translation.ko: 침수된 차 옆을 지나가는 카약 탄 남자부터 보여주죠

translation.en: -Hi, Pumpkin! -Hi.
[Carol] You must be Justin.
-[Justin] Oh, hi. -Hello.
I think he smells fine.
Do you need something? Because we're on a deadline.
Of course. Oh, for your big story!
Too bad it has to be about a hurricane.
Why is that "too bad"?
The news is always scaring people about the weather.
translation.ko: 날씨에 관한 뉴스는 사람들을 겁주기만 하잖아

translation.en: They say a hurricane's coming, then nothing happens.
translation.ko: 허리케인이 온다고 해도 늘 별일 없이 지나가는데

translation.en: Now why did I come in here?
Oh, God, OK. I walked in, I sat down...
Oh! What is it?
Oh... OK, yes.
Honey, is your work email password the same as your regular email password?
translation.ko: 네 직장 이메일 비밀번호가 그냥 이메일 비밀번호랑 같니?

translation.en: -It is, but don't say it out loud. -It's "team edward," all lowercase?
-OK, thank you. -Yep.
God, I can't believe she's working here.
translation.ko: 말도 안 돼 엄마가 여기서 일한다니

translation.en: I can't believe she has your password.
At least I used to have work as an escape, you know?
translation.ko: 전엔 그래도 출근하면 엄마를 피할 수 있었다고요

translation.en: But now there's no boundaries.
She's just gonna be on top of me, every single day!
Listen, this problem will solve itself.
translation.ko: 괜찮아요 이 문제는 저절로 해결될 거니까

translation.en: Have you seen my edit of Chuck firing interns?
translation.ko: 척이 인턴 해고하는 걸 짜깁기한 영상 봤어요?

translation.en: [Chuck] Why am I sweating?
You're fired!
Eye contact. Fired.
My ex-wife has that sweater. You're fired.
translation.ko: 전처랑 똑같은 스웨터를 입었네 넌 해고야

translation.en: You're fired. Fired!
...put that there? You're fired.
Is this a tour or can I fire them?
Who's this old guy? You're fired!
-[Greg] Chuck, that's a mirror. -Then smash it!
[Chuck] Wheelchair, you're fi--
See? No intern's ever lasted more than a few weeks.
translation.ko: 봐요, 다들 몇 주도 못 버티고 해고됐어요

translation.en: Yeah.
Katie, did you need a file called "Hurricane Research: Important"?
Because it just disappeared. [Carol] Oh, I just spoke with Greg, he is single.
translation.ko: 그게 막 사라졌거든 참, 그레그 지금 싱글이라더라

translation.en: [Carol] So I invited him to your cousin Tami's wedding.
translation.ko: 그래서 네 사촌 태미의 결혼식에 초대했지

translation.en: You think he'll need a hotel or share a bed with Dad?
translation.ko: 방을 따로 잡아줘야 할까? 아니면 아빠랑 같이 재울까?

translation.en: Can you go to the post office? I need some stamps.
translation.ko: 우체국에 가서 우표 좀 사다 주실래요?

translation.en: Oh, no I can't. No time. Have to get Chuck his snack at 2:30.
translation.ko: 안 돼, 2시 30분에 척한테 간식 줘야 하거든

translation.en: No, um... Chuck takes his nap at 2:30.
-He gets his snack at three. -Oh, right.
It's hard to remember things when you're my age.
[Carol] Plus Alzheimer's and insanity do run in our family.
OK!
God, I lied to my mom to get her fired. Please don't judge me.
translation.ko: 엄마가 잘리도록 거짓말을 했어요 욕하지 마요

translation.en: Bad news, Wendelson. Your hurricane got downgraded.
translation.ko: 나쁜 소식이에요 허리케인 등급이 하향 조정됐대요

translation.en: -What? -[Greg] A Category Two won't make a lead.
No, I'm still the lead. I'm gonna fix this.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 메인은 제 거예요 방법을 찾을게요

translation.en: You better find a way to change the weather.
Hey, Beth, you preparing for an earthquake? [laughing]
The mega-quake isn't until 2018.
And you won't be laughing then. I dropped a raisin.
translation.ko: 그땐 그렇게 못 웃겠죠 아, 건포도 주운 거예요

translation.en: Any contacts at the National Weather Service?
I'm trying to get a tropical storm upgraded back to a hurricane.
translation.ko: 열대 폭풍을 허리케인으로 다시 격상시켜야 하거든요

translation.en: Sure. I can call Bernie in Storm Designations.
translation.ko: 그럼요, 폭풍 분류과 버니한테 연락해 줄게요

translation.en: -Oh, really? -No!
There's no Bernie in Storm Designations.
There's a Barney in Weather Classifications, but I'm not calling him!
translation.ko: 기상 경보과의 바니는 있지만 그 사람한텐 연락 안 할 거고요

translation.en: Why not?
You can't re-categorize a storm for no reason!
translation.ko: 아무 이유도 없이 폭풍 등급을 바꿀 순 없어요

translation.en: Unless you want to get called before an Ethics Tribunal
at the Barometric Castle in St. Paul!
[Beth] Is that what you want?
-How did your rain dance go? -Can't talk now.
translation.ko: - 기우제는 잘 지냈어요? - 지금은 말 못 해요

translation.en: I've got work to do and it's 2:30.
-[shouting] Where's my snack? -Oh, God.
I'm supposed to have my snack at 2:30!
-[Chuck yells] -Katie! Stamps. Who's yelling like that?
translation.ko: 케이티, 우표 사 왔어 누가 저렇게 소리를 지르니?

translation.en: Sounds like the Pathmark by me that's all Hispanic now.
translation.ko: 집 근처 마트 같네 요즘엔 손님들이 다 히스패닉이야

translation.en: It's Chuck, about his snack.
What?
You told me he got his snack at three!
Did I? I...
Alright, who screwed this up? Who's the intern?
translation.ko: 실수한 놈 나와 새 인턴이 누구야?

translation.en: Mr. Pierce, I can explain.
-Are you the intern? -No, Katie Wendelson.
translation.ko: - 자네가 인턴이야? - 아뇨, 전 케이티 웬들슨이에요

translation.en: Segment Producer?
-I helped you with your kidney stones. -That's OK, dear. Hi.
translation.ko: - 신장 결석 때 도와드렸는데 - 나한테 맡기렴, 안녕하세요

translation.en: -Hi. -I'm Carol. I'm the intern.
But you're, uh...
-Carol, we have a schedule. -I know.
And when people disrespect that schedule, they disrespect me!
translation.ko: 스케줄을 무시하는 건 날 무시하는 것과 같아요

translation.en: I'm sorry.
I've been in this business for 30 years and I will not be disrespected!
translation.ko: 난 30년간 이 일을 했는데 무시당하는 것만은 못 참습니다

translation.en: I was on the ground in Kosovo!
I shot a flaming arrow at Mike Wallace's Viking funeral!
translation.ko: 마이크 월리스의 바이킹 장례식에서 불화살을 쐈어요

translation.en: -[Chuck] And another thing-- -Jeez Louise, calm down!
You're a graying old man, you're throwing a tantrum about a snack.
translation.ko: 머리가 희끗한 양반이 간식 따위로 화내서 되겠어요?

translation.en: The world's not gonna end if you don't get your little pizza bagel.
translation.ko: 피자 베이글 좀 안 먹는다고 세상이 끝나기라도 한대요?

translation.en: Which you don't need by the way.
You hold your weight in your belly, that's heart attack city
translation.ko: 허리춤에 두툼한 이게 심장마비로 가는 지름길이라고

translation.en: according to Good Housekeeping. OK?
I mean, you're not like that, um...
Oh, gosh! Who was that actor who died? You know, mob show?
translation.ko: 그 죽은 배우 이름이 뭐죠? 그 마피아 드라마에 나왔던...

translation.en: -Come on, think! -Marlon Brando?
No, he was in that movie with "Old Christine."
-[Carol] Come on, you know! -James Gandolfini.
-[Carol] Yes! -It's James Gandolfini.
You're not like him, Chuck, but you could be.
translation.ko: 그 사람 같진 않지만 그렇게 될지도 몰라요

translation.en: Take care of yourself and stop getting so mad.
translation.ko: 몸 관리 잘하고 쓸데없이 열 내지 마요

translation.en: OK, go to your office.
Oh, alright. OK.
That's right. I'll make you a bowl of popcorn, OK?
-[Chuck] OK. -[Carol] Go, go!
Did I tell you the wrong time?
Nice try, Pumpkin.
I can always tell when you're lying.
That was amazing! You got Chuck to do what you wanted.
Can I... kiss you?
I don't think I can do this internship.
Wait. Mom... come on.
[Carol] No, really. I've been running around all day,
translation.ko: - 기다려요, 이러지 마세요 - 아니, 괜찮아 종일 뛰어다녔더니 삭신이 다 쑤시는구나

translation.en: and I am exhausted.
You're right, Pumpkin, I'm too old for this.
translation.ko: 딸램 말이 맞아 난 이런 일엔 너무 늙었어

translation.en: Goodbye, everyone!
[Carol] Thank you for the opportunity.
Kathryn.
[music plays] ♪ The things you think Are useless, I can't understand ♪
translation.ko: 네가 쓸모없다는 것들 난 이해할 수가 없어

translation.en: ♪ Are you reeling in the years? ♪
-Could you hear my psych-up music? -Um... Yes.
translation.ko: - 내 에너지 충전 송 들었어? - 아마도요?

translation.en: Pretty fresh beat, huh?
Well let me blow your mind.
That song is 40 years old.
OK. They need you for a run-through.
No, I have to speak to that mature intern first.
translation.ko: 안 돼, 그 전에 그 원숙한 인턴과 할 얘기가 있어

translation.en: Can you send her in?
Sir? Sir? She quit.
Get her back here, or you and the other interns are fired!
translation.ko: 그럼 다시 데려와 자네랑 다른 인턴도 자르기 전에

translation.en: I'm... not an intern.
-What the hell was that? -I'm on it.
You better be on it! Or you'll be on Craigslist selling your body for rent money!
translation.ko: 그러는 게 좋을 거예요 중고 사이트에서 몸 팔기 싫으면!

translation.en: Sorry! That was too rough.
You know what? Coffee. Coffee run on me.
Mom, why didn't you answer your phone?
I don't have to. You're not my boss anymore.
translation.ko: 안 받을 수도 있지 네가 내 상사도 아닌데

translation.en: OK, Chuck says he needs to talk to you.
You only came here because you need my help.
No. I'm very sorry that I tried to get you fired, OK?
translation.ko: 아뇨, 해고시키려 한 건 정말 죄송해요, 진짜예요

translation.en: I gave up everything for you.
translation.ko: 엄만 널 위해 모든 걸 포기했어

translation.en: Now I just want a little dream for myself and you won't let me have it.
translation.ko: 드디어 내 꿈을 찾나 했는데 네가 그걸 막을 줄은 몰랐다

translation.en: But Mom, why can't you get a different little dream?
Why do you have to horn in on mine?
translation.ko: - 왜 제 꿈에 끼어들어요? - 안녕, 케이티

translation.en: -[Dave] Hi, Honey. I'm just gonna close the door so I can read my magazine.
translation.ko: - 왜 제 꿈에 끼어들어요? - 안녕, 케이티 문 좀 닫을게 잡지에 집중이 안 돼서

translation.en: Mom, work is hard enough without you there, OK?
I have nothing for my lead hurricane segment.
translation.ko: 허리케인 뉴스에 쓸 만한 게 하나도 없어요

translation.en: And Greg and everybody else there thinks that I suck.
translation.ko: 그레그랑 다른 사람들은 내가 무능하다고 생각하고

translation.en: And the worst part is... they are probably right.
translation.ko: 더 끔찍한 건 그게 사실일지도 모른단 거죠

translation.en: Oh, you do not suck. You're great. You've always been great!
translation.ko: 넌 무능하지 않아 넌 훌륭해, 늘 훌륭했어

translation.en: Look at this shrine.
[Carol] You were the smartest kid. And a track star!
translation.ko: 넌 제일 똑똑한 애였고 끝내주는 육상 선수였어

translation.en: And you were amazing in Les Mis as "Dock Whore."
Mom, do you remember how I got on the track team?
translation.ko: 엄마, 제가 육상팀에 어떻게 들어갔는지 기억해요?

translation.en: I didn't make it and then you went to the coach and you forced him to let me on.
translation.ko: 선발전에서 탈락했는데 엄마가 코치를 협박해서 절 넣었죠

translation.en: You have always interfered, I can never do anything on my own!
translation.ko: 엄마가 계속 간섭하면 전 아무것도 혼자 못 할 거예요

translation.en: And then what happened next? Who won these trophies?
translation.ko: 그다음엔 어떻게 됐어? 이 트로피는 누가 탄 건데?

translation.en: I got you on the team, but I didn't run the race for you, did I "dum-dum?"
translation.ko: 내가 팀에 넣어주긴 했지만 경주에서 뛴 사람은 너야, 띨띨아

translation.en: I guess I did do the running.
You just made me believe that I could.
translation.ko: 엄마는 할 수 있다는 믿음을 준 거고요

translation.en: And you can do this too. You are a good little journalist.
translation.ko: 이번에도 할 수 있어 넌 훌륭한 저널리스트야

translation.en: [Katie] Yeah, you're right.
And a good journalist knows when to scrap their story.
translation.ko: 좋은 저널리스트는 준비한 뉴스를 버릴 줄 알죠

translation.en: Am I supposed to follow you?
Mom, yeah!
Oh!
[panting] I'm scrapping the lead!
What? But I just sent you to return henceforth with the "Old."
translation.ko: 네? '노인'을 데리러 집에 간 거 아니었어요?

translation.en: Justin, get me clips of workers in their 60s!
I'm on it!
Amy, get that econ. professor from N.Y.U. on the phone!
translation.ko: 에이미, 뉴욕 대학의 그 경제학 교수를 연결해줘요

translation.en: Brenda, stats on baby boomers reentering the workforce.
translation.ko: 브렌다, 베이비 붐 세대의 재취업 관련 통계를 가져와요

translation.en: -I'm not Brenda. -"Copy that!"
Story's not about a hurricane anymore. It's about a tsunami!
translation.ko: 메인 뉴스 소재는 허리케인이 아니라 쓰나미에요

translation.en: What?
A journalist knows when to scrap a lead if a better one comes along.
translation.ko: 더 나은 뉴스가 있어서 준비한 뉴스를 버리는 거죠

translation.en: -What? -That's... Greg, you said that.
-I didn't. When? -You said that to me.
-Yesterday. -Why are we talking?
The show is in 20 minutes!
It's in 20 minutes? 20? Oh, great!
-Carol. -Yes.
Earlier, you called me a "graying old man."
I'm sorry. I have no filter. I've ruined dozens of surprise parties.
translation.ko: 미안해요, 입이 방정이라 망친 깜짝 파티만 한 트럭이에요

translation.en: No, I want to know if it's true.
Does my hair look gray on camera?
It's just that, uh...
Nobody around here tells me the truth.
Your hair does look gray.
Thank you, Carol.
And also, when you wear a green tie, you look exactly like a leprechaun.
translation.ko: 그리고 녹색 넥타이를 하면 레프러콘이랑 똑같이 생겼어요

translation.en: -It's your ears, they're very-- -Baby steps, Carol. Baby steps.
translation.ko: - 귀 모양 때문에... - 한 번에 하나씩 하죠, 캐럴

translation.en: [presenter] Live from Secaucus, New Jersey, this is The Breakdown.
The lead is changing! Guys, the lead is changing, OK? The package is on B.
translation.ko: 메인 뉴스 바뀌었어요 새 패키지는 B에 있고요

translation.en: Chuck, there's new copy in your prompter.
translation.ko: 척, 프롬프터에 새 뉴스가 들어갈 거예요

translation.en: Good evening. Tonight we take a look at the so-called "Silver Tsunami,"
translation.ko: 안녕하십니까, 오늘은 이른바 '실버 쓰나미'에 관해 알아봅니다

translation.en: America's surplus of baby boomers and their predicted drain
translation.ko: 미국에 넘치는 베이비 붐 세대는 은퇴 후 사회 보장 재정을 고갈시킬 것으로 예측됐죠

translation.en: on Social Security when they retire.
translation.ko: 은퇴 후 사회 보장 재정을 고갈시킬 것으로 예측됐죠

translation.en: As more older Americans choose to reenter the workforce,
translation.ko: 하지만 많은 은퇴자는 재취업을 선택하고 있습니다

translation.en: the future of our economy seems brighter than ever.
translation.ko: 우리 경제의 미래는 그 어느 때보다도 밝습니다

translation.en: Proving that seniority does count for something, Greg.
translation.ko: 연장자의 경험은 의미 있는 자산인 게 증명됐죠, 그레그

translation.en: I mean, Portia.
Thanks, Chuck.
Next up: Is there a silent killer hiding in your family's handguns?
translation.ko: 다음 소식은, '내 집안 권총에 숨어 있는 조용한 암살자'입니다

translation.en: -[Portia] That's when we return. -And we're clear.
Good job, little one.
On to the next crisis...
Who will tell Chuck that his hair looks like Ronald McDonald?
translation.ko: 누가 척한테 저 머리가 맥도날드 광대 같다고 말하는 건데

translation.en: Handling Chuck sounds like a job for my mom.
translation.ko: 척을 다루는 건 우리 엄마가 제격인데

translation.en: It's too bad that she quit.
It really is. She could have talked him into so many things.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 척을 이렇게 저렇게 하게 만들 수 있었을 텐데

translation.en: If you want her back, I'm willing to negotiate.
What are your terms?
I convince my mom to come back and be our intern,
and you let me do one lead story every week.
translation.ko: 일주일에 한 번씩 메인 뉴스를 맡겨주세요

translation.en: Done. Oh! I thought you were going to ask for a raise.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 연봉 인상을 요구할 줄 알았는데

translation.en: -Which I would have given you. -No! Damn it!
translation.ko: - 게다가 들어주려 했는데 - 안 돼, 빌어먹을!

translation.en: You know what? No. Baby steps, baby steps.
Hey, Pumpkin! The show was great.
[Carol] I loved the story you did about me!
And what did you think of Chuck's hair? Zazzy, right?
It's real "zazzy," yeah.
Listen, Mom, I think you should come back and be our intern.
I don't know, Katie. Having me around is a big sacrifice.
translation.ko: 글쎄다, 케이티 너한테 괜히 짐 되긴 싫어

translation.en: I can't do that to you.
I've already given you genes for hairy arms and scoliosis.
It's not a sacrifice, Mom.
You make me believe in myself.
And I need you.
Aw, really? I don't know, Katie.
I have to think about it, OK?
OK, Mom.
[Carol] Just kidding!
I'm in! We're co-workers!
translation.ko: 나 돌아왔어! 우린 이제 직장 동료야!

translation.en: I can't come in tomorrow. Two gays from my soap are getting married.
translation.ko: 참, 내일은 못 와 내 드라마에서 게이들이 결혼한대

translation.en: [Chuck, on TV] Why is this break taking so long?
[Chuck] Where's Carol? Get Carol.
They need me on the floor!
-[Chuck] Carol? -[Greg] Can we get Carol?
Wrong way, Mom!
[Chuck] Is Carol here? Is she in the building? Carol!
translation.ko: 캐럴! 건물에 있긴 한 거야? 캐럴! 캐럴!
